snippet: Jason Itzler, who pleaded guilty to promoting prostitution three weeks ago, told a judge that he wanted a new lawyer after reading a profile of the one he had.
abstract: Jason Itzler, who pleaded guilty to promoting prostitution, is allowed to fire attorney Mark Jay Heller during sentencing and replace him with new lawyer; New York State Supreme Court Justice Thomas Farber grants Itzler just days to decide whether to withdraw his plea deal and go immediately to another trial, putting him at risk of a longer sentence. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: Jason Itzler arrived in court on Tuesday to be formally sentenced to prison, a solemn reckoning for most criminal defendants. But for the self-proclaimed King of All Pimps, the day played out like one more act in a never-ending immorality play. Mr. Itzler shouted over a judge and his own lawyer, Mark Jay Heller, saying that since signing a plea deal three weeks ago, he had read a 2010 profile of Mr. Heller and realized that he had been wrongly treated.

headline.main: After Guilty Plea, Pimp Fires Lawyer During Sentencing
